p.s: inIn the given opinion piece Language learning in the UK: 'can't, won't, don't' John Worne explainesexplains the situation with foreign language learning in the UK and his opinion about it.
According to Worne since seven years fewer and fewer students are willing to study foreign languages at university level.
Although more primary schools teach foreign languages the exam results have stacknatedstagnated, and the number of exams has declined since 1990, while there was even an increase before 1990.

Since many people think the ability to speak foreign languages is getting less important, because of reasons like smart tech or the fact that englishEnglish is an international language, Worne states that he thinks this is completely wrong.
The reason for his opinion is that most of the UK businesses need foreign language skills.
Hence, the lack of such skills results in dependence and less growth.
The only good aspect Worne sees is that some universities offer to students to study foreign languages as well along sidealongside.
Worne also thinks that it is necessary that students and parents do more to learn oreor foster the learning of foreign languages.
